    • Constructor Detail

      • Inode

        public Inode(int inode_num,
             java.lang.String file_mode,
             short user_id,
             long file_size,
             int accessed_time,
             int creation_time,
             int modified_time,
             int delete_time,
             short group_id,
             short hard_links,
             int[] direct_pointers,
             int indirect_pointer,
             int double_indirect_pointer,
             int triple_indirect_pointer)
        This is the inode object representing a file system inode.
        Parameters:
        inode_num - The inode number of the inode.
        file_mode - The access mode of the inode.
        user_id - The id of the user owning the inode.
        file_size - The memory allocated to the inode's pointers.
        accessed_time - The last access time of the inode.
        creation_time - The creation time of the inode.
        modified_time - The last time of modification of the inode.
        delete_time - The deletion time of the inode.
        group_id - The group id of the owner of the inode.
        hard_links - The number of hard links to the inode.
        direct_pointers - A list of the direct pointers to the inode's files.
        indirect_pointer - A pointer to the indirect pointers of the inode.
        double_indirect_pointer - A pointer to the double indirect pointers of the inode.
        triple_indirect_pointer - A pointer to the triple indirect pointers of the inode.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This will check if all the pointers associated with the inode object are empty.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Inode has no pointers.
